aseelaa wrote:

>>I'd recommend inspecting the junit/tests directory to see if 
>>LoadedFromJar.class exists.  If it does, then ensure your CLASSPATH 
>>includes the JUnit installation directory.  If it does not exist, 
>>
>then 
>
>>reinstall junit3.7.
>>
>>Mike
>>
>
>junit.tests does contain LoadedFromJar.class.  My classpath already 
>includes the Junit installation directory.  I copied code from the 
>refactoring book, and that works fine (in all 3 interfaces), but the 
>test still gives an error in the last test. I also tried running the 
>junit.tests.AllTests (instead of junit.samples.Alltests), and that 
>fails on the 63rd test (and the first 62 pass OK).
>

Interesting.

So your CLASSPATH includes something like c:\junit, and not 
c:\junit\junit.jar, right?

What platform are you using?

Mike
